item.title: Basic Autoclicker (C++)
item.dc:creator: @suck_my_r2h suck my r2h
item.description:
@suck_my_r2h wrote:

This doesn’t do a colorfix, and all it does is keep clicking the left mousebutton, so you’ll have to move the mouse onto whatever you want it to click on, but, at least it saves the trouble of repeadetly clicking

#include <windows.h> #include <stdlib.h> int APIENTRY WinMain(HINSTANCE hInstance, HINSTANCE hPrevInstance, LPSTR lpCmdLine, int nCmdShow) { POINT *p = new POINT; GetCursorPos(p); if(MessageBox(0,"Do you want to start the autoclicker?","Question",MB_YESNO|MB_ICONQUESTION)==IDYES){ while(!GetAsyncKeyState(VK_F8)){ GetCursorPos(p); mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTDOWN,p->x,p->y,NULL,NULL); mouse_event(MOUSEEVENTF_LEFTUP,p->x,p->y,NULL,NULL); Sleep(1000+rand()%230); // You can alter the sleep time and the random millisecond wait if you want. } delete p; } return 0; }
It can be stopped by pressing F8.

Read full topic
